messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

LGTM.

Do we need to fix the root cause and let incref always wrap the error?

On Sat, Dec 22, 2012 at 2:40 PM, minux <minux.ma@gmail.com> wrote:

> Do we need to fix the root cause and let incref always wrap the error?

I personally want to see such uniform of errors eventually but perhaps not now.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=1fd839e10187 ***

net: fix timeout tests

R=golang-dev, minux.ma
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/7003049

I agree, I think we could stand for a CL that normalises the error reporting in this package. 

On 22/12/2012, at 16:53, Mikio Hara <mikioh.mikioh@gmail.com> wrote:

> On Sat, Dec 22, 2012 at 2:40 PM, minux <minux.ma@gmail.com> wrote:
> 
>> Do we need to fix the root cause and let incref always wrap the error?
> 
> I personally want to see such uniform of errors eventually but perhaps not now.

subject: code review 7003049: net: fix timeout tests
